dry up.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if a supply of something dries up, it comes to an end and no more is available
dry up.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if something such as a river dries up, the water in it disappears
dry up.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Across central and west Texas, waterholes and wells have dried up.
Taking too much water for household use is drying up the river.
dry up.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if someone dries up, they stop talking
dry up.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Everyone became embarrassed and conversation dried up.
dry up.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to rub plates, dishes etc dry with a cloth after they have been washed
dry up.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: I’ll just dry up these mugs and we can have a coffee.
dry up.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to no longer be available or active
dry up.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: There are fears that investment could dry up.
Sales could dry up if this trend continues.
